title: 10 Products AT Readers Couldn’t Stop Buying in September, Including a Cloudlike Washable Rug for Under $200
description: These are the products that had you clicking "add to cart" this July. READ MORE...
author: Nikol Slatinska
excerpt: We cover a lot of products at Apartment Therapy, and when our readers like them just as much as we do, our work feels that much more rewarding. Whether we’re reviewing a closet organizer that tackles your messy handbag collection or a piece of cookware that we’re using for daily meal prep, it’s always fascinating to see which picks get picked up by you.
text: DecoratingFurnitureShoppingWe independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.We cover a lot of products at Apartment Therapy, and when our readers like them just as much as we do, our work feels that much more rewarding. Whether we’re reviewing a closet organizer that tackles your messy handbag collection or a piece of cookware that we’re using for daily meal prep, it’s always fascinating to see which picks get picked up by you. Last month, we covered a number of cool products that made furnishing, decorating, and organizing our spaces more exciting. When September came to a close, we once again wondered, which of those picks did you love, too?We looked through the data and were delighted to find that so many of our favorite home finds have been such major hits with our audience, from floral-print rugs to a do-it-all Ninja coffee maker. Some of the top performers were expected, while others served as somewhat of a surprise. And, because you’re also probably curious to know which products your fellow readers have been using, we’re sharing the list. The products below are the best of the best — according to, well, you!1 / 10Wayfair$179.20was $320.00Larger rugs can cost a pretty penny, so you should definitely take advantage of Wayfair’s major discounts in this category. This one, which is from a collaboration between Rifle Paper Co. and Loloi, is especially beautiful with its showstopping floral print. Additionally, the rug is made with the brand’s cozy CloudPile microfiber that feels especially soft underfoot.2 / 10Target$15.00We resonated with how TikTok creator Mikayla Richardson organized her bathroom's under-sink cabinet by stacking two clear double bins and filling them with toiletries, and it seems like our readers did, too. At about 9 inches tall and a litter over 1 foot wide, these Target bins are also the perfect size for your closet, pantry, or desk. Plus, you can see everything inside them, so you know where your things are and when to restock.3 / 10Amazon$47.99This 14-piece mixing bowl set comes with everything you need to cover your meal prep needs. It includes two 10-ounce prep bowls, a 20-ounce mixing bowl, a 1.5-quart mixing bowl, a three-quart mixing bowl, a five-quart mixing bowl, an eight-quart mixing bowl, and seven individual lids. Plus, the bowls are stainless steel and will stand the test of time.4 / 10Walmart$47.00was $129.99This sturdy metal shelving unit is perfect if you don’t have enough storage space for all of your kitchen gear, garage items, or basically anything else. Each shelf can hold up to 250 pounds and the lockable wheels allow you to move in between spots easily. Best of all, when it’s not in use, the shelving unit folds down to save space.5 / 10Amazon$18.30was $42.69Perfect for small bathrooms, this handy storage cabinet easily slides into tight corners, like between the toilet and shower. More importantly, this accessory offers plenty of multi-functional storage space. Amazon reviewers note being able to store as many as four rolls of toilet paper in the shuttered compartment, as well as other items, like feminine products and skincare essentials, on the top three shelves.6 / 10Ashley$359.99was $490.99When contributor Sarah was looking for a cozy accent chair, she found that many of the models she liked were more than $1,000. Then, she came across this olive-green number from Ashley, which is under $500. "They’re substantial in size, extremely comfortable to sit in, and really shine in my living room," she wrote of her new chairs. "The turned legs are gorgeous and add the right amount of traditional flair to my space, which features a mixture of contemporary and antique finds, and the material honestly reminds me of a fancy mohair, which does not run cheap." You'll find the chairs easy to assemble, too.7 / 10Amazon$16.99This is the perfect time of year to not only rewatch "Gilmore Girls," but also to grab this under-$20, TikTok-viral advent calendar based on the show. When you open the calendar, you’re met with a number of iconic images from the show, like the Luke’s Diner sign, the Chilton uniform patch, and the Stars Hollow gazebo. Inside the envelopes, you’ll find even more show paraphernalia, but you’ll have to order the calendar to see what exactly that entails!8 / 10Amazon$15.96was $23.46More than 1,000 Amazon shoppers bought this pack of bathroom cleaner sprays in the past month, and for good reason. CLR’s cleaner tackles buildup around your sink, showerhead, and tub — and it’s even safe to use on glass and stainless steel. The cherry on top is that the Brilliant Bath spray is part of the EPA’s Safer Choice Program, which recognizes the solution as a safer alternative to traditional chemicals. That’s a huge plus if you have kids or your bathroom’s ventilation isn’t the greatest.9 / 10Walmart$149.00was $198.00What makes this coffee machine so versatile is not only its dual-brew design but also its whopping 13 brew sizes: five individual sizes for grounds, four carafe sizes, and four pod sizes. You’re not just limited to hot or iced black coffee, either. A built-in frother allows you to prepare all kinds of frothy drinks, including lattes, macchiatos, cappuccinos, and whatever else your heart desires.10 / 10Amazon$9.99If you prefer to use bar soap (especially in the shower), this $10 Amazon find is for you. Designed to keep your soap dry and within easy reach, this soap dish can hold up to 11 pounds, and it's also super easy to clean thanks to its removable tray and drainage holes. But the absolute best part? This dish is super easy to remove and reposition, which makes it a dream for renters. No wonder it’s so beloved!
html:
• Decorating
  • Furniture
  • Shopping

We independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.

We cover a lot of products at Apartment Therapy, and when our readers like them just as much as we do, our work feels that much more rewarding. Whether we’re reviewing a closet organizer that tackles your messy handbag collection or a piece of cookware that we’re using for daily meal prep, it’s always fascinating to see which picks get picked up by you. Last month, we covered a number of cool products that made furnishing, decorating, and organizing our spaces more exciting. When September came to a close, we once again wondered, which of those picks did you love, too?

We looked through the data and were delighted to find that so many of our favorite home finds have been such major hits with our audience, from floral-print rugs to a do-it-all Ninja coffee maker. Some of the top performers were expected, while others served as somewhat of a surprise. And, because you’re also probably curious to know which products your fellow readers have been using, we’re sharing the list. The products below are the best of the best — according to, well, you!

1 / 10

Wayfair

$179.20

was $320.00

Larger rugs can cost a pretty penny, so you should definitely take advantage of Wayfair’s major discounts in this category. This one, which is from a collaboration between Rifle Paper Co. and Loloi, is especially beautiful with its showstopping floral print. Additionally, the rug is made with the brand’s cozy CloudPile microfiber that feels especially soft underfoot.

2 / 10

Target

$15.00

We resonated with how TikTok creator Mikayla Richardson organized her bathroom's under-sink cabinet by stacking two clear double bins and filling them with toiletries, and it seems like our readers did, too. At about 9 inches tall and a litter over 1 foot wide, these Target bins are also the perfect size for your closet, pantry, or desk. Plus, you can see everything inside them, so you know where your things are and when to restock.

3 / 10

Amazon

$47.99

This 14-piece mixing bowl set comes with everything you need to cover your meal prep needs. It includes two 10-ounce prep bowls, a 20-ounce mixing bowl, a 1.5-quart mixing bowl, a three-quart mixing bowl, a five-quart mixing bowl, an eight-quart mixing bowl, and seven individual lids. Plus, the bowls are stainless steel and will stand the test of time.

4 / 10

Walmart

$47.00

was $129.99

This sturdy metal shelving unit is perfect if you don’t have enough storage space for all of your kitchen gear, garage items, or basically anything else. Each shelf can hold up to 250 pounds and the lockable wheels allow you to move in between spots easily. Best of all, when it’s not in use, the shelving unit folds down to save space.

5 / 10

Amazon

$18.30

was $42.69

Perfect for small bathrooms, this handy storage cabinet easily slides into tight corners, like between the toilet and shower. More importantly, this accessory offers plenty of multi-functional storage space. Amazon reviewers note being able to store as many as four rolls of toilet paper in the shuttered compartment, as well as other items, like feminine products and skincare essentials, on the top three shelves.

6 / 10

Ashley

$359.99

was $490.99

When contributor Sarah was looking for a cozy accent chair, she found that many of the models she liked were more than $1,000. Then, she came across this olive-green number from Ashley, which is under $500. "They’re substantial in size, extremely comfortable to sit in, and really shine in my living room," she wrote of her new chairs. "The turned legs are gorgeous and add the right amount of traditional flair to my space, which features a mixture of contemporary and antique finds, and the material honestly reminds me of a fancy mohair, which does not run cheap." You'll find the chairs easy to assemble, too.

7 / 10

Amazon

$16.99

This is the perfect time of year to not only rewatch "Gilmore Girls," but also to grab this under-$20, TikTok-viral advent calendar based on the show. When you open the calendar, you’re met with a number of iconic images from the show, like the Luke’s Diner sign, the Chilton uniform patch, and the Stars Hollow gazebo. Inside the envelopes, you’ll find even more show paraphernalia, but you’ll have to order the calendar to see what exactly that entails!

8 / 10

Amazon

$15.96

was $23.46

More than 1,000 Amazon shoppers bought this pack of bathroom cleaner sprays in the past month, and for good reason. CLR’s cleaner tackles buildup around your sink, showerhead, and tub — and it’s even safe to use on glass and stainless steel. The cherry on top is that the Brilliant Bath spray is part of the EPA’s Safer Choice Program, which recognizes the solution as a safer alternative to traditional chemicals. That’s a huge plus if you have kids or your bathroom’s ventilation isn’t the greatest.

9 / 10

Walmart

$149.00

was $198.00

What makes this coffee machine so versatile is not only its dual-brew design but also its whopping 13 brew sizes: five individual sizes for grounds, four carafe sizes, and four pod sizes. You’re not just limited to hot or iced black coffee, either. A built-in frother allows you to prepare all kinds of frothy drinks, including lattes, macchiatos, cappuccinos, and whatever else your heart desires.

10 / 10

Amazon

$9.99

If you prefer to use bar soap (especially in the shower), this $10 Amazon find is for you. Designed to keep your soap dry and within easy reach, this soap dish can hold up to 11 pounds, and it's also super easy to clean thanks to its removable tray and drainage holes. But the absolute best part? This dish is super easy to remove and reposition, which makes it a dream for renters. No wonder it’s so beloved!
